title: Zero de conduite - Jeunes diables au college (1933)
description:
So effervescent and charming that one can easily forget its importance in film history, Jean VigoÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s enormously influential portrait of prankish boarding-school students is one of cinemaÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s great acts of rebellion. Based on the directorÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s own experiences as a youth, ZÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â©ro de conduite presents childhood as a time of unfettered imagination and brazen rule-flouting. ItÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s a sweet-natured vision of sabotage made vivid by dynamic visual experimentsÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½including the famous, blissful slow-motion pillow fight.
